function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of contact with hands, minimizing contact with door handles and elevator buttons can reduce the risk of contamination specifically for COVID-19.","Impact":"Reduced risk of COVID-19 transmission.","Mitigation":"Implement touchless or hands-free systems for doors and elevators, and encourage regular hand washing and disinfection.","Technologies":"Touchless entry systems, automated door openers, UV-C disinfection technology.","People":"Residents, building occupants.","Owner":"Building management, architects, interior designers."},{"Description":"Ventilating/cleaning clothes worn outside, washing hands with soap for a long time, and ventilating spaces are important measures to reduce the risk of COVID-19 transmission.","Impact":"Reduced risk of COVID-19 transmission and contamination in indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Encourage regular hand washing, provide adequate ventilation, and establish cleaning and disinfection protocols for clothes and surfaces.","Technologies":"High-efficiency HVAC systems, air purifiers, UV-C disinfection technology.","People":"Residents, building occupants.","Owner":"Building management, architects, interior designers."},{"Description":"Relationship of the house with the exterior, including windows and balconies, has been important during the pandemic for visual and auditory socialization and well-being.","Impact":"Supports mental and emotional well-being during extended periods of staying at home.","Mitigation":"Design and optimize balcony spaces for socialization and relaxation, prioritize natural light and ventilation in building design.","Technologies":"Balcony design features, natural lighting solutions, audiovisual systems for socialization.","People":"Residents, building occupants.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, building developers."}]}
